senses.sense_definition: A <w>liberal</w> person, often used in political contexts to refer to someone with progressive views.

examples.text: The senator's speech was clearly designed to provoke the <w>libs</w> in the audience.
He argues that <w>libs</w> want to change the country's economic policy.

senses.sense_definition: Short for <w>liberation</w>; a movement seeking equal rights and freedom for a specific group.

examples.text: She was a strong advocate for women's <w>lib</w> during the seventies.
The history book discusses the impact of the gay <w>lib</w> movement.

senses.sense_definition: A <w>library</w>, particularly in computing contexts referring to a collection of pre-compiled routines or resources.

examples.text: You need to install the graphics <w>lib</w> before compiling the code.
The standard <w>lib</w> contains many useful functions for file handling.

senses.sense_definition: A member or supporter of the Liberal Party (especially in Australia, Canada, or the UK).

examples.text: The <w>Libs</w> have announced their new candidate for the upcoming election.
Many voters switched from Labor to the <w>Libs</w> this year.
The research focuses on improving the recycling process for <w>LIBs</w>.
Modern electric vehicles rely heavily on high-capacity <w>LIBs</w>.

senses.sense_definition: The Liberal Party or the Libertarian Party.

examples.text: He has been a lifelong supporter of the <w>Lib</w> Dems.
The <w>Lib</w> candidate campaigned on a platform of lower taxes.
In the shorthand of the chart, the sun position is marked as <w>Lib</w>.
The planetary alignment in <w>Lib</w> suggests a time for balance.

senses.sense_definition: To castrate or geld an animal.

examples.text: The farmer had to <w>lib</w> the young bull before releasing it into the pasture.
It was common practice to <w>lib</w> the livestock in the spring.
